intro: Luzula campestris subsp. alpestris, commonly known as alpine woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, greenish-brown flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow, grass-like, and arranged in a compact rosette. Luzula campestris subsp. alpestris is adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils and cold climates.
